Since all of these APIs are available through the non experimental

CronetEngine, these tests should use that one directly.

This will prevent the below bugs from being reintroduced (technically

now the opposite would happen, i.e. them getting ignored if one used

ExperimentalCronetEngine.Builder instead of CronetEngine.Builder, but

entry.title: [viz] Parameterize SkiaReadbackPixeltestNV12 tests on MultiplanarSI
entry.content:
In preparation for further extending CopyOutputNV12() support for

MultiplanarSI, this CL parameterizes the tests of that function on

MultiplanarSI being enabled/disabled. These tests currently all pass

with MultiplanarSI, as we've enabled support for blit requests and

are not yet passing NV12_MULTIPLANE for creation requests in the

test even if MultiplanarSI is enabled. We will do so in the next CL

where we implement support for these codepaths.

entry.title: Revert "Generate stdlib GN rules from the Rust src tree when rolling Rust"
entry.content:
This reverts commit e41c960e5892727412b755b55da8d0ee2c2c4821.



Reason for revert:

Still broken, see second bug.



Original change's description:

> Generate stdlib GN rules from the Rust src tree when rolling Rust

>

> Reland of https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4569316

>

> This avoids the need to:

> 1. Build gnrt locally

> 2. Then download the roll CL

> 3. Copy Rust packages to prod

> 4. gclient sync

> 5. Run `gnrt gen --for-std`

> 6. Reupload the CL

>

> In order to have the Rust roll pass the trybots.

>

> upload_revision.py will, when rolling rust, do the `cargo vendor`

> step in the Rust git checkout to get its dependencies, install

> cargo and rustc in a sysroot, build `gnrt` using cargo, and then

> run `gnrt gen --for-std=third_party/rust_src/src` which regenerates

> the GN rules for the Rust stdlib from the updated version of Rust.

>

> Previously gnrt gen --for-std would generate rules from the Rust

> library found in //third_party/rust-toolchain, but that requires

> Rust to already be rolled, so this now uses the feature of specifying

> the Rust source tree root to --for-std.

>

> Bug: 1401042, 1451335

> Change-Id: Iad9cbeebde624232a538c05c197f78d7d1e3e97f

> Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:android-rust-arm32-rel,android-rust-arm64-rel,android-rust-arm64-dbg,linux-rust-x64-dbg,linux-rust-x64-rel,mac-rust-x64-dbg,win-rust-x64-dbg,win-rust-x64-rel

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4595858

> Commit-Queue: danakj

> Reviewed-by: Hans Wennborg

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1154411}



Bug: 1401042, 1451335

Change-Id: Ib5270c4cc63d72b8d015cf38aca7aae2da65f3cc

Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:android-rust-arm32-rel,android-rust-arm64-rel,android-rust-arm64-dbg,linux-rust-x64-dbg,linux-rust-x64-rel,mac-rust-x64-dbg,win-rust-x64-dbg,win-rust-x64-rel

entry.title: Rework Graphics.Smoothness.Jank to use V3 signals
entry.content:
For PercentDroppedFrames we upgrading from V1 to V3 with more accurate

signals for the importance of the frames. V3 is now a guardrail metric.



We want to eliminate the old V1 path. However some metrics still use it.

Jank is one such metric. This change updated V3 to perform

the calculation.

entry.title: Revert "Fix Kiosk mode when prelaunching Lacros"
entry.content:
This reverts commit fb4ef418fc958f2165e068ef053f9b72c660e1fa.



Reason for revert: b/285828403



Original change's description:

> Fix Kiosk mode when prelaunching Lacros

>

> Instead of Kiosk's LacrosLauncher manually calling

> InitializeAndStartIfNeeded, this change makes it so

> that the SessionState is switched to LOGGED_IN_NOT_ACTIVE.

>

> BrowserManager will now launch or resume Lacros in that

> state as well, in addition to ACTIVE.

>

> Bug: b:279155522

> Change-Id: Iefafbc381401108ed7cf3103326d5c4a820cc31b

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4546954

> Reviewed-by: Ben Franz

> Commit-Queue: Andrea Orru

> Reviewed-by: Hidehiko Abe

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1153078}

entry.title: Remove host_cpu = x86
entry.content:
We have fuzzer bots which build for host_cpu = x86. This is wrong - they

only care about target_cpu = x86, but also had host_cpu = x86 to support

libprotobuf-mutator fuzzers.



Unfortunately host_cpu = x86 is a lie, and we can no longer sustain that

lie now that Rust needs to load procedural macro shared objects into the

host 64-bit compilers.



Fortunately, the reason why we had to specify host_cpu = x86 is now

gone. It was to support a protobuf compiler plugin to switch protobufs

from lite to full runtime so LPM could work, and that plugin is now

gone. So we can remove the assert and remove host_cpu = x86.



Bug: 1451027

Change-Id: I7a33852b917016101ff9b130ec5be3ef9b8725e0

entry.title: [Payments] HTTP HEAD request for payment method manifest.
entry.content:
Before this patch, Chrome would download payment method manifests via

HTTP GET, which would check the HTTP headers for a Link

rel="payment-method-manifest" first and then, failing to find it, would

fallback to reading the body of the HTTP response. This HTTP GET had a

1MB file limit.



The HTTP GET was problematic for web developers who used the payment

method identifier URL to host both human-readable content and the API

end-point HTTP Link rel="payment-method-manifest" header. If the

human-readable content grew above 1MB, then Chrome rejected the API

end-point, even though it did not need to download the full

human-readable content.



This patch changes Chrome to download the payment method manifest via

HTTP HEAD request on the payment method identifier URL. If the HTTP

headers do not have a Link rel="payment-method-manifest", then Chrome

will fall back to HTTP GET request on this URL.



After this patch, Chrome is more resilient against changes to

human-readable content that is hosted on the same URL as the payment

method identifier API end-point with HTTP header Link

rel="payment-method-identifier".



Bug: 1450596

Change-Id: I26975138546b35a6c77142ffe1f3f4b64df1d833

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4579537

Commit-Queue: Rouslan Solomakhin

Reviewed-by: Nick Burris

entry.title: Add SVGElement::SynchronizeAllSVGAttributes() for the "sync all" case
entry.content:
The various implementations of `SynchronizeSVGAttribute()` are basically

only handling the "sync all" case, and the base implementation in

`SVGElement::SynchronizeSVGAttribute()` handles the "single" case by

calling `PropertyFromAttribute()` and then synchronizing the attribute

object that's returned. De-virtualize the "single" case and let a new

`SynchronizeAllSVGAttributes()` handle the "sync all" case. This is

essentially achieved by renaming the existing variant and removing the

checks on the `name` parameter.



Rename the `SynchronizeAllSVGAttributes()` helper to

`SynchronizeListOfSVGAttributes()` to help differentiate between the

different variants. Use the helper in a few more instances.



Change-Id: I739a9005d4484d81c9b6b53c1c7365e960a9442c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4598007

Reviewed-by: Steinar H Gunderson

Commit-Queue: Fredrik Söderquist

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1154857}

entry.title: [//gpu] Eliminate GLES2 command decoders' lazy binding code on Windows
entry.content:
The command decoders' lazy binding is a no-op if the following is true:

- For the validating command decoder, Texture::HasUnboundLevelImage() is

false

- For the passthrough command decoder,

TexturePassthrough::is_bind_pending() is false



Following recent refactorings and simplifications, neither Texture::SetUnboundLevelImage() nor TexturePassthrough::set_bind_pending() is

ever called on Windows, meaning that the decoders' lazy binding is

always a no-op on that platform. This CL eliminates that code from being

built on Windows, leaving Apple as the only remaining platform with lazy

binding (will be tackled once the VTVDA refactoring is complete).

entry.title: [ios] Replace WebStateInsertedAt() with WebStateListChanged()
entry.content:
This CL replaces WebStateInsertedAt() API with WebStateListChanged().



This CL is a part of refactoring WebStateListObserver API:

Step 1: Introduce WebStateListChanged() w/ kReplace type in WebStateListChange and replace WebStateReplacedAt() with it

Step 2 [this CL]: Introduce kInsert type and replace WebStateInsertedAt()

Step 3: Introduce kMove type and replace WebStateMoved()

Step 4: Introduce kDetach and kDestroy type and replace WebStateDetachedAt() and WebStateListDestroyed()

Step 5: Replace Will*() with WillWebStateListChanged()

Step 6: Migrate WebStateActivatedAt() to WebStateListChanged()



No behavior changes.



See https://docs.google.com/document/d/1I1QUZAexM1eMI2l2oriZl5GARrtofNI0SxHUPB4h-YE/edit?usp=sharing for more details (internal document).

entry.title: Revert "[Extensions] Enable tabCapture with workers and offscreen documents"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 3302a41972d9b5a278901a4b745e1df2ad9e7b10.



Reason for revert: OffscreenApiTest.TabCaptureStreams is very flaky on Windows CI, see crbug/1453212.



Original change's description:

> [Extensions] Enable tabCapture with workers and offscreen documents

>

> MediaStreams are unavailable in ServiceWorker contexts. This means

> the tabCapture API doesn't work in Manifest V3 background contexts

> (since these are service worker-based). The primary alternative to

> functionality that's tied to a DOM or Window context is to use

> offscreen documents; however, these (by design) do not have access

> to extension APIs, which means they can't access the tabCapture API.

> This effectively means there's no good way to use the tabCapture

> API in a background context in Manifest V3.

>

> Fix this by:

> - Allowing service worker contexts to use

> `tabCapture.getMediaStreamId()`. This returns an ID that can

> later be used to fetch a media stream, rather than returning the

> MediaStream object itself. As such, it's (conceptually)

> compatible with service worker contexts.

> - Allowing offscreen documents to use the media stream ID to

> start capture via the navigator.getUserMedia() API (which is

> what tabCapture.capture() already used).

>

> In practice, this entails allowing extension contexts to use a

> media stream generated by another context *on the same origin*, rather

> than restricting it to the same frame that created the stream ID.

> (This isn't a change in security or privacy, since the extension could

> already pass any of this information between its own contexts.)

> Additionally, update `tabCapture.getMediaStreamId()`'s implementation

> to not rely on the presence of a RenderFrame.

>

> Add an end-to-end test using offscreen documents to capture the

> stream of an active tab.

>

> Bug: 1400269

> Change-Id: I1e0f0a46d098e56357881ed64dfd249b6b692936

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4514180

> Reviewed-by: James Cook

> Reviewed-by: Mark Foltz

> Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

> Reviewed-by: Elad Alon

> Commit-Queue: Devlin Cronin

> Reviewed-by: Tim

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1154676}

entry.title: [test] Limit Apache KeepAliveTimeout to 10s
entry.content:
Currently, we set KeepAliveTimeout to 9999s. This keeps connections

alive for very long, causing timeouts in tests with many connections

because we run out of worker process/threads. This patch changes

KeepAliveTimeout to 10s.



The Apache documentation (https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/core.html#keepalivetimeout) says: "Setting KeepAliveTimeout to a high value may cause performance problems in heavily loaded servers. The higher the timeout, the more server processes will be kept occupied waiting on connections with idle clients."



In the logs from the bugs below, we indeed see the following message:

"AH00161: server reached MaxRequestWorkers setting, consider raising the MaxRequestWorkers setting". With this patch, the message does not

appear in the logs anymore and the tests stop flaking.



Note that the patch changes some text expectations for network headers

because the KeepAliveTimeout value is a header.





Bug: 1417314

Bug: 1450925

Bug: 1419059

entry.title: DanglingPtr: mark unretained dangling ptr in BinaryFMCService
entry.content:
Doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YQCh_mezoSF1fWS9TaMEh0Whumb8eNe0KWV8MBs7sFs



We detected those callbacks are invoked using dangling pointers.

This is something we would like to detect and potentially ban.



In the meantime, we need to annotate them using:

base::UnsafeDanglingUntriaged



Outside of the experiment, it is a no-op.

Within the experiment, it skips DumpWithoutCrashing.



Bug: 1451874,1453191

entry.title: [iOS][Bkmrks] Update presentation logic for bookmarks coordinator
entry.content:
`_bookmarkNavigationController` is reset asynchronously on dismiss in

`BookmarksCoordinator`. This may cause state error when reopening

bookmarks. This cl waits for the dismiss to reset `_bookmarkNavigationController` before presenting it again.

Tentative fix for the crash in bugs as it's difficult to reproduce.



Fixed: 1446502, 1449104, 1449105

entry.title: [win] Add [[nodiscard]] to RegKey methods that conditionally modify `this`
entry.content:
`base::win::RegKey` has a few methods that conditionally change the key

to which the instance refers. Subsequent operations performed after

calling these methods could be dangerous if they were to operate on the

original key (e.g., open a subkey and then delete values in that

subkey). Add `[[nodiscard]]` to these methods to ensure proper use.



Bug: none

Change-Id: Ia692a81fc993d2f1d7c4862d05df2a58018f9380

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4593349

entry.title: [LCPP] Only instantiate LCPP when the feature is enabled
entry.content:
Before this CL, every `blink::LocalFrame` could lazily instantiate

`blink::LCPCriticalPathPredictor`.

After this CL, `blink::LCPCriticalPathPredictor` is only instantiated in

`blink::LocalFrame::GetLCPP()` call if:

- the frame is main frame, and

- the feature flag is enabled



This CL also moves the feature flag to blink/public/common so we can

access the flag from both `chrome/browser/predictor` and

`third_party/blink`.



Bug: 1419756

Change-Id: I9de08201f3b2964a5bbd8b035280e4c0495e8d8a

entry.content:
Recording of Screen AI usage, and triggering download on the first use

should happen on browser UI thread as they need access to local state

and component updater.

While this was ensured before for the usages outside Ash, requests

triggered from Ash violated this and need an extra post to the correct

thread.



As a side change, `ImageAnnotationWorker` is updated to trigger

download if Screen AI DLC is not available, and bind annotator only

when DLC is downloaded.





AX-Relnotes: n/a.

Bug: 1278249

entry.title: Adopt base::NoDestructor for KeyedService factories
entry.content:
For changes under /chrome/browser/sync_file_system



It replaces base::Singleton, following the latest recommendation

in base/ and browser_context_keyed_service_factory.h.



For factories with no logic in the destructor, it makes no difference.



For this particular instance, tests require refactoring to avoid

stateful factories. The new approach leans on SetTestingFactory(),

which is the recommended way to override factory logic.



LSC doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1x1LqRQyfBOmpMkNQBYs7QBPSxLtuiImvmgcJYI_kaS4/edit?usp=sharing



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: DanglingPtr: mark unretained dangling ptr in ChromeDownloadManagerDelegate
entry.content:
Doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YQCh_mezoSF1fWS9TaMEh0Whumb8eNe0KWV8MBs7sFs



We detected those callbacks are invoked using dangling pointers.

This is something we would like to detect and potentially ban.



In the meantime, we need to annotate them using:

base::UnsafeDanglingUntriaged



Outside of the experiment, it is a no-op.

Within the experiment, it skips DumpWithoutCrashing.

entry.title: [Preloads] Fix flakey lacros installation test.
entry.content:
This test was flakey because it takes time for the web app

installation in lacros to be registered with app service.

If the installer reports a successful install,

we add a run loop to wait for the registration to occur

before we check for its presence in the app registry cache.

entry.title: mojo-js: Add support for WebUIJsBridge to WebUIBrowserInterfaceBrokerRegistry
entry.content:
Adds a `ForWebUIWithJsBridge()` method to

WebUIBrowserInterfaceBrokerRegistry that can be used to register

Mojo interfaces for a WebUI. For now this method is only use in

content tests, but it's meant to replace `ForWebUI()`, so it will

eventually be used outside of content in future CLs.



This CL includes a hand-written implementation of a WebUIJsBridge

in tests. The hand-written implementation will be used as a model

for the follow up CL that generates WebUIJSBridge.

entry.title: [FilesBulkPinning] Ensure metadata changes invalidate all cached rows
entry.content:
When metadata is retrieved the cache gets properly invalidated, however,

only the items that are visible in the viewport get updated by the

MetadataUpdateController. For items outside the viewport, these are

cached in the FileListModel and when a user scrolls back the rows

back into view, they can contain stale information.



Currently many features appear to be invalidating their own individual

metadata items (e.g. available offline toggle does the pinned icon,

onDirectoryChanged does the modified time etc.). With the introduction

of inline sync status this meant the status gets cached and not updated

if out of view for long enough.



This fix invalidates the indices that have new metadata changes and

relies on the fact that the MetadataCacheSet only relays information for

items which actually get changed (instead of blindly updating everything

item even if nothing changes).



Fixed: b:283204213

Change-Id: If9e211a12465064b316a42799d1f973ce51e2bf8

entry.title: [text-wrap-pretty] Fix fallback
entry.content:
This patch fixes falling back to the bisection algorithm.



`NGScoreLineBreaker` may be disabled by two ways:

1. When `CollectInlines` detects unsupported objects. This is

detected by `NGInlineNode::IsScoreLineBreakDisabled()`.

2. When `NGLineBreaker` detects unsupported objects.

Properties that don't require `CollectInlines` are detected

at this stage.



When it's disabled at 2, this patch ensures that the bisection

is invoked to balance the text.

- new-folder

- delete

- move-to-trash

entry.title: Pass in parent container id when creating touch selection magnifier.
entry.content:
Add parent_container_id_ to the touch selection magnifier runner and set

it when the magnifier runner instance is created, rather than directly

using an ash::ShellWindowId from within the magnifier. This is to remove

a dependency on ash, so that the magnifier code can be more easily moved

to a directory where it can be used from both ash and lacros.



Still need to work out what window id to use when creating the lacros

magnifier runner instance (or maybe just use the root window), but that

can be handled later.

entry.title: arc: Prevent multiple registration of ArcMountProvider
entry.content:
ArcSessionManager registers ArcMountProvider to

GuestOsMountProviderRegistry in OnVmStarted() and unregisters it in

OnVmStopped(). However, this can result in registering multiple

instances of ArcMountProvider when previous ARC session did not finish

normally and OnVmStopped was not called (due to vm_concierge crash

etc.). This CL fixes this problem by unregistering the old instance of

ArcMountProvider (if it exists) before registering a new one.



BUG=b:279378611, b:284416355

TEST=With CL:4498132 reverted, check that only one "Play files" appears

TESt=on Files app and contents under "Play files" remain accessible

TEST=after killing vm_concierge with `kill -9 ` and

TEST=restarting ARCVM by launching Play Store.



Change-Id: Ibd3e9722fd9ce7b17eca8d06c9b8df1564ff7a4a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4570149

Reviewed-by: Josh Horwich

Commit-Queue: Momoko Hattori

entry.title: Add ScopedTerminationChecker to quantify ungraceful exits
entry.content:
In particular, on Android, when Chrome is backgrounded, we close the

current log synchronously. Chrome may be killed during this time (e.g.

user swipes the app, or OS wants to immediately reclaim some memory),

which can cause data loss due to histograms being snapshotted and put

into a log, but the log never being fully finalized and stored.



(If Chrome is killed before we start finalizing the log, it's fine

because all the data will be in the persistent file. If Chrome is

killed after finalizing/storing the log, it's fine because the log

will be stored in Local State).



This CL emits a histogram before we close the log, and after we

finished closing the log (and storing it). So the "before" and

"after" buckets should match in count if Chrome is never killed

during this time. But there are some flaws with this solution:

- There may be a lagging effect since the "after" sample won't be in

the same log as the "before" histogram.

- There may be some bias if the latter sample, for some reason, is

more likely to be lost. I try to protect against this by making

ScopedTerminationChecker a no-op if the persistent histogram system

is not in use in the current session.

(So it seems to me that if there are problems with this histogram, it

would be about undercounting the "after" bucket).



I plan to check the data quickly. If the data looks good (i.e. the

"before" and "after" buckets are pretty much equal so there is nothing

much to worry about), then I will leave this as is since it's "good"

enough. Otherwise, if they are not equal, I will implement a more

sophisticated checker to confirm that it is accurate. In particular,

before closing the log, allocate some small object on the persistent

memory that contains a bool that is set to false. After closing the

log, set this bool to true. Then the consumer of the PMA file will

take care of emitting some histogram that indicates whether the

ScopedTerminationChecker fully completed.



This is in preparation of merging subprocess metrics on backgrounded.

The reason why I'm doing this is because I am adding extra work to

the "OnBackgrounded" handler, so it could possibly make the data loss

window larger?



Bug: 1293026

Change-Id: I75de6d8536dbba8d0db03156e1190cfa62419a9c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4580610

Reviewed-by: Roger McFarlane

Reviewed-by: Alexei Svitkine

Commit-Queue: Luc Nguyen

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1154727}

entry.title: Revert "Re-enable LaunchingAppThatRequiresNetworkWhilstOfflineShouldShowNetworkScreen"
entry.content:
This reverts commit cff67e9bedc6e9a0c37c87e7ec436b4fabe24367.



Reason for revert: Still flakily fails, e.g. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Chromium%20OS%20ASan%20LSan%20Tests%20%281%29/51633/overview



Original change's description:

> Re-enable LaunchingAppThatRequiresNetworkWhilstOfflineShouldShowNetworkScreen

>

> This test flakily failed at the WaitForOobeScreen step, because we jumped straight into the network screen instead of holding on the splash screen for 10 seconds as expected.

>

> The reason we jumped straight into the network screen is the following callpath happening during installation:

> NetworkUiController::InitializeNetwork

> -> AppLaunchSplashScreenHandler::UpdateAppLaunchState

> -> NetworkUiController::OnNetworkStateChanged

> -> KioskLaunchController::OnNetworkLost

> -> NetworkUiController::OnNetworkLostDuringInstallation

> -> NetworkUiController::ShowNetworkConfigureUI.

>

> This was fixed by https://crrev.com/c/4583229 by blocking the call from AppLaunchSplashScreenHandler::UpdateAppLaunchState to NetworkUiController::OnNetworkStateChanged.

>

> Bug: b:284000771

> Test: LaunchingAppThatRequiresNetworkWhilstOfflineShouldShowNetworkScreen

> Change-Id: I689856f33dcc40d6f9ef5f5f58166cc2f3d02ac3

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4556910

> Reviewed-by: Irina Fedorova

> Commit-Queue: Irina Fedorova

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1154401}



Bug: b:284000771

Change-Id: I90186cbebc4558631e102edd0ae37c3197572a28

entry.title: [RemoveLegacy] Simplify SetupBoxLayoutExtraInput()
entry.content:
`SetupBoxLayoutExtraInput()` updates only `BoxLayoutExtraInput::

containing_block_content_inline_size`. So,



* Returns the value instead of updating the data member

* Rename the function to `ContainingBlockContentInlineSize()`

* Inline `CalculateAvailable*SizeForLegacy()`.



This CL should have no behavior changes.



Bug: 1229581

Change-Id: I70d7d5a985099d5d293138d828adce2f003601a5

entry.title: Test order of toggle events in addition to order of DOMSubtreeModified events.
entry.content:
I realized while writing

https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9400#discussion_r1221692104 that the

ordering of the `open` attribute manipulation is also exposed through

`toggle` events, so this tests those events in addition to

`DOMSubtreeModified` events.

entry.title: Exempt base64-encoded data from redaction in feedback logs
entry.content:
Large base64-encoded data items in the feedback logs tend to contain

substrings matched by individual redaction tools. Exempt known

base64-encoded items from redaction to avoid corruption of the

these items.

entry.title: [PDF OCR] Add a notification message when there are no OCR results
entry.content:
When OCR doesn't extract text from PDF images, the PDF Viewer need to

notify users of it. Add a new string that conveys this notification

message. Also, fix an error that led to failure of updating the status

node when there are no OCR results.



Note that the status node will be deleted in case that PDF doesn't

need to be OCRed (i.e. already has accessible text and no image) even if

the user enables the PDF OCR feature flag.



AX-Relnotes: n/a.

entry.title: [LCPP] Implement ToElementLocatorString
entry.content:
This CL introduces ToElementLocatorString() that returns the locator

string that will represent the element's relative position inside the

document.



The locator will be used in combination with LCPCriticalPathPredictor

to prioritize loading of the LCP element resource in the subsequent

page loads.
